moves.4. Nxd4 Bd7: Nf6 is the more common response.
moves.5. Nc3 Nf6 6. Bc4 a5 7. O-O Be7 8. a4 O-: I think I would have moved Bc2 somewhere or played Rd5.
moves.24. Nf3: Black's bishop is in real trouble now.  Rde4 is a good counter threat.
moves.24... Rde4 25. Bb5: Odd how almost all black's major pieces are on white squares.
moves.25... Bd3 26. Bxe8: Bxd3 is better.  It was a free bishop, netting white three points.
moves.26... Bxf1: Here black should have played Rxe8+.  Black responds Kh7, THEN black trades bishop for rook.
moves.27. Kxf1 Rxe8 28. Rxd5 Rc8 29. Nd4 c5 30: Oops.  Knight forks hurt.  Rc7 would have discouraged that, better than moving the king.  Black needs to drive the passed c pawn, but faces a big hurdle.
